item.title: Bitcoin Price On A High Tension Wire
item.description:
Bitcoin Price On A High Tension Wire

Bitcoin price is pushing higher once again but the market is struggling to make a new high since last week. Could this be the final push to resistance? This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member?

item.title: FBI Contracted Former Tor Developer To Create Torsploit Malware
item.description:
FBI Contracted Former Tor Developer To Create Torsploit Malware

Ever since the Silk Road platform was shut down by law enforcement, people have been wondering if the Tor network was as secure as it is touted to be. As it turns out, a former part-time Tor Project developer helped the FBI in developing the Torsploit malware.

item.title: Bitcoin Technical Analysis for 05/09/2016 - Big Resistance at $465
item.description:
Bitcoin Technical Analysis for 05/09/2016 - Big Resistance at $465

The $455 price level first started acting as resistance on the 24th of April, when the market formed a double-high around $455. Since the 24th, the $455 pivot has acted as resistance a total of five times. During this weekend's rally, price managed to close above the $455 zone.

item.title: Coinfirm launches the first Blockchain Lab situated in Central Europe
item.description:
Coinfirm launches the first Blockchain Lab situated in Central Europe

According to recent reports, Coinfirm, a blockchain startup that focuses on data management has launched its first blockchain lab, over in Central Europe. The Blockchain Lab aims to become the go-to hub for crypto-development, collaboration and research in the region.

item.title: Steemit: New Social Media Platform Which Pays You to Post
item.description:
Steemit: New Social Media Platform Which Pays You to Post

Steemit, a new social media platform where everyone gets paid to post online, has been released in beta. In the age of multiple social media platforms, many of them entrenched players, how will new users react to Steemit? Steemit is a relatively new company, founded in early 2016 by Ned Scott and Daniel Larimer.

item.title: Industry Report: Liberty Leads to Imprisonment, Wright Steps Away
item.description:
Industry Report: Liberty Leads to Imprisonment, Wright Steps Away

Eager to catch up on the latest digital currency news? A Liberty Reserve head honcho will now serve time behind bars, and Dr. Craig Wright is backing away from claims that he's the real Satoshi Nakamoto.

item.title: Report: Russian Ministries Question Bitcoin Criminal Liabilities
item.description:
Report: Russian Ministries Question Bitcoin Criminal Liabilities

T he Ministry of Justice and the Interior Ministry in Russia have - according to reports - questioned the "public danger" that Bitcoin supposedly brings, as proposed by the Russian Ministry of Finance.

item.title: Swiss City to Accept Bitcoin Payments for Government Services - CoinDesk
item.description:
Swiss City to Accept Bitcoin Payments for Government Services - CoinDesk

The city of Zug, Switzerland, has announced it will pilot a bitcoin payments project that will allow local citizens to pay for public services using digital currency. Zug, a well-known Swiss financial hub long associated with the country's tax haven reputation, kicked off the initiative during a local government hearing on 3rd May.
